root.title: Chaa-khol I (е-13)
root.place: It was found near the river Chaa-khol the left inflow of the river Ulug-Kem in Republic of Tyva.
root.store: It is transferred to Minusinsk museum in 1892. Inv. #33.
root.general: Places where monuments Е 13 to Е 23 have been found out remained under water basins of «The Sayan-Shushensk Power Station».
root.description: It is made of darkish blue granite. There are 5 lines of text. There are lines similar to a head and trunk of a person.
root.size: Height - 1,41 m, length - 0,16-0,20 m, width - 0,16 m.
root.investigation: Oshurkov found in 1892. W.Radloff, H.N.Orhun, S.E.Malov, P.Aalto, E.Tryjarsky, D.D.Vasilev, A.S.Amanzholov and other scientists investigated.
root.details: Н.Базылхан "Көне түрік бітіктастары мен ескерткіштері (Орхон, Ениесей, Талас)" //"Қазақстан тарихы түркі тілді деректемелерде" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.179.

pdf.f_title: Памятники тюркской рунической письменности азиатского ареала.
